Transcript: W1: Hi, can I please speak with Thomas Hyatt? It’s regarding the construction at Franklin’s Studios. He’s the fund manager, right?
W2: Yes. Can I ask who’s calling?
W: This is Sharon Jasmin, the studio director at Franklin’s Studios. We are upgrading our studios but we’re supposed to receive some funding today that didn’t go through. The builders have stopped construction until I can guarantee payment.
W2: OK, I’ll put you through to Mr. Hyatt now. Hold please.
W1: Thank you.
M: Hello? Mrs. Jasmin?
W1: Good morning, Mr. Hyatt. Are those funds coming through today? I really want to stay on target with our project so we need to keep construction going.
M: Definitely. I’m actually at the bank now doing all the transfers so the money should be in your account within half an hour. I’ll send you a confirmation receipt via cell phone; please message me back when you get it.

question.text: Who is Mr. Hyatt?
What problem does Mrs. Jasmin mention?
What does Mr. Hyatt ask Mrs. Jasmin to do?

answer.explanation:
M: This is Mike Judge, your host for the morning news here at QQBC 99.5. Today our guest is business leader Karen Chambers. She recently opened a chain of health food stores across the state. How did you get the idea, Ms. Chambers?
W: Well, I majored in food and nutrition and I minored in business administration. So, my goal was to utilize what I learned in college to open a successful company.
M: Ah, I see. What factor do you think has contributed most to the success of your chain of stores?
W: I think it’s due to the recent trend of people showing enormous interest in health and fitness.

question.text: Who most likely is the woman?
What did the woman want to do?

W-Br Carl, you cleaned all the equipment in the laboratory last night, right? 65l received a complaint from one of the lab technicians this morning that I wanted to talk to you about.
M-Cn Really? What was the problem?
W-Br Well, he said that the microscope lenses were dirty. 66 When you cleaned them, did you wipe them in a circular motion, like the manual indicates? If you don’t, it could just spread this dirt around.
M-Cn Oh, you know I think I might have done that the wrong way. Sorry about that.
W-Br It’s OK, other people have made that same mistake. 67l’d better copy that page in the manual and post it in the lab for all the staff.

M: Hello. I picked up a camping pack this morning but it’s missing some of the items.

M: I have the mats, sleeping bags and the carry bag. I thought there was supposed to be one more item in there.
W: Ah yes, I know what it is. Are you able to drop in the store today? I will give you a 15% refund because of the mistake.
M Oh, really? That’s very kind of you. I’ll come this afternoon and pick it up.

W: Hi, we are renovating our boardroom and I’d like to purchase some cherry wood tables for our conference room. Q1 I am having a meeting with some very important clients on Friday. So I’d like to have them delivered tomorrow. What is the cost for an emergency delivery?
M: Hold a moment please... Next day delivery is an extra seventy-five dollars.
W: Really? That is expensive. I thought if my order was over three hundred dollars, delivery would be free of charge.
M: Well, yes. Q2 Are you planning to order the cherry wood tables?
W: Q2 Yes, I would like two of them.
M: OK then, Q3 I will make sure that your order arrives tomorrow morning before midday, and delivery will be free of charge.

answer.explanation:
Hi, Charlotte. Sorry to interrupt, but Q1 I’ve got a management meeting tomorrow about expenses for next quarter, and …I’m waiting for the department budget proposal.
W-Br: I just finished. The only issue is with the estimated cost of office supplies for next year. Based on the requests I’ve received, Q2 we'll need to increase our office supply spending by quite a bit.
M-Cn: Oh, that's not good. There's not very much flexibility for increasing our spending right now. Q3 I’ll bring this up at the meeting. Let's see what the other managers think about trying to renegotiate our contracts with the vendors we buy office supplies from. Hopefully we can get lower rates.

(B) To ask for a deadline extension
(C) To inform the woman about a scheduling change

answer.text: (A) To request a document from the woman

W: Nice to meet you, Mr. Gomez. Q1 I’m sure after you hear about our business, you will want us to provide food and beverages for your company’s various events.
M: Nice to meet you, Ms. Gates. Thank you for coming today. I haven’t inquired about your services because your company is located out of town. Q2 I didn’t think you could provide services to US.
W: Rose and Lily Co. is willing to travel anywhere within the state in order to meet our clients’ needs. Our prices don’t change depending on distance, so you don’t need to worry about that.
M: Oh, I’m glad to hear that. In that case, we will consider your services. What are your specialties? Q3 Do you think I could sample some of the food and beverages you provide?

answer.explanation:
M: Ms. Franklin, here is the inventory list in case we need to order anything. Please let me know by today because the supply company is closing for Christmas soon.
W: I see. Well, Christmas is coming up so we will need to wrap a lot of gifts for the staff presents. Also, I’m tired of holding my phone while typing and we don’t have anything for me to use. Can you please order me something?
M: Yes, no problem. I will order that for you. Also, we are out of business cards and we have some new employees beginning after Christmas. I suggest we have business cards ready when they arrive, otherwise we may look unprofessional.
W: Good idea. Go ahead and order those too. Can you please send me the order form so I can double-check it before you send it away?
M: I’ll email it to you soon.

question.text: Why do they need to send the order today?
choices: (A) Because the company is closing for Christmas.
(B) Because the company is closing for New Years.
(C) The company doesn’t have the item.

answer.text: (A) Because the company is closing for Christmas.

Transcript:
W: Hello, I need to send a package to my brother who lives overseas in Germany. What delivery method would be best?
M: Well, it really depends on what you’re sending. Because we are a public post office, we don’t offer that many options.
W: Actually, it was my brother’s birthday last week, but I forgot. So I’m in a hurry to send this package. Also, what I’m sending is somewhat fragile.
M: In that case, I suggest you use a private delivery service. Private companies provide a larger variety of services that we don’t offer.

W-Am: Hello, Q1&2 this is Cindy Kato from Northern Builders. Your magazine printed an article about our company in the June issue, and I'm calling to let you know there's a mistake in it.
M-Au: I'm sorry to hear that, Ms. Kato. We work really hard to get all of our facts right, but occasionally, mistakes do get through. Could you tell me exactly what the problem is?
W-Am: Yes. The article said that our firm recently built the sports stadium in Greensville - which is correct - but it was accompanied by a photograph of a different stadium.
M-Au: I apologize - I'm sure there was a mix-up at layout. Q3 I'll find the right picture so that the magazine can publish a correction.

answer.explanation: Q1 Welcome to the Friday employee fitness program. I’m very excited to be the first instructor offering an exercise class here in the newly renovated fitness center. And it’s great to be located in the same building as the company cafeteria since we meet right before the lunch hour. As you probably know, Q2 we’ll be meeting every Friday for the next three months. By the end of that time, I hope you’ll all be feeling stronger and healthier. This class is designed for all levels, so don’t worry if you’re a little out of shape right now. Q3 I’ll demonstrate the exercises and show you ways to modify them so everyone can get a good workout without overdoing it.

answer.explanation: OK. everyone, just a quick meeting before we open the ice cream shop today. If you take a look at this chart, you’ll see this week’s winning ice-cream flavor. As promised, the flavor that got the most votes will be discounted by 25 Percent for a week. I’d like to thank Tomas again for his creative idea of holding this weekly contest. Our customers have loved this promotion, and it has really increased sales. I know a lot of you have great ideas too! Remember you can share them with me anytime.

Transcript:
Welcome to the Museum of Electronics. Here you can see some of the earliest televisions, radios, and telephones. This month, we have a special exhibition that focuses b developed during World War II. George Butler, an expert in the field, will be giving a short talk describing the history behind this marvelous technology. There is also a workshop for students aged 13 to 19 where they can assemble their own radio transmitter. It will be a good opportunity to learn a few basic principles of electronic engineering.

answer.explanation: This is a reminder that legendary soccer player Tommy Durant will be signing autographs at Dave’s Sport Shop at 1:00 P.M. tomorrow.(81) You are encouraged to bring your own items, such as clothes or books, for Mr. Durant to autograph. Also at this time, parents will be able to sign their children up for a summer soccer camp that will be run by Tommy Durant. The camp is limited to twenty children, so anyone who is interested should sign up early.

answer.explanation: Thanks for coming to today’s meeting. First, I’d like to congratulate you on the Rivera Shoes account. As you know, last quarter our agency launched an ad campaign for our client Rivera Athletic Shoes. It featured soccer star Giovanni Casati. Today I can share with you the news that since those ads were released, Rivera has seen sales increase by almost forty percent. I’ve been in this industry a long time, and I’ve never seen anything like it. To keep the momentum going, we’re going to bring back Giovanni for another series of ads. His training schedule is pretty tight, but we’re hoping to set up a photo shoot with him sometime in April

choices: (A) He is impressed by some news.
(B) He is unfamiliar with a product.
(C) He is confused by a suggestion.
(D) He is looking for some sales figures.

answer.text: (A) He is impressed by some news.

question.text: What does the speaker hope to schedule in April?

answer.explanation: Thanks for coming to our staff meeting today. Q1 It is with great pride that I announce that our mobile telephone coverage area has grown. We have tripled the area we serve and are now able to provide service to the entire region. I know that you have all worked very hard and Q2 I want to thank you for your great efforts and the many hours you’ve put in so that this could happen. Already our revenue has increased by 30 percent. Q3 To celebrate our achievement, and to show you our appreciation, we will be having a company picnic in Memorial Park on Saturday. Your families are welcome to join us. There will be games and lots of great food. I hope you all can come to the picnic

choices: (C)It will be offered to fewer people.

choices: (C)  There will be a staff meeting.
(D)A new company president will be named.

answer.explanation: Welcome back to your local radio station WXFD 93.7 with the morning news update. Q1 Yesterday, the Clinton Town Council passed a new law prohibiting pet owners from bringing their pets onto public beaches. Q2 Tim Kellerman, who was newly elected to the town council last month, justified the decision by arguing that pets can bother other beach- goers. Those who violate the law will have to pay a fine of $300. Q3 Up next, we will be taking calls from listeners to hear their reaction to this new measure.

question.text: What is the radio broadcast about?
choices: (A) The opening of a pet store

question.text: According to the speaker, what did Tim Kellerman do recently?
What will listeners most likely hear next?

answer.explanation: Q1 Welcome to New Employee Onentation. Here’s what we’re doing today. First, you’ll each get an employee identification badge. Then we’ll take a tour of the facility. Q2 The folder in front of you contains a map of the building. Please refer to the map during the tour. There are also some forms in the folder for you to complete. After the tour, we’ll all have lunch together in the cafeteria. If you get separated from the tour, just meet us at the cafeteria at noon. Again, refer to the map in your folder if you need help finding anything. After lunch, your supervisors will show you to your specific workstations. Q3 And if you’re wondering when you’ll finally submit all of your paperwork, it’s after lunch, when you meet with your supervisors.

question.text: What is the main purpose of the talk?
What is included in each person’s folder?
When will the employees hand in the forms?

answer.explanation: Attention, conference attendees. Thank you for your patience while you wait for US to solve this delay. Q1 Unfortunately, the computer that is to be used during the keynote speaker’s presentation is having problems. As a result, we are currently transferring the necessary files onto a different computer. Q2 We plan to get underway with the presentation in half an hour. In the meantime, feel free to enjoy some of the refreshments provided near the entrance. Q3 We will dim the lights in order to indicate that the presentation will be beginning. Please return to your seats at that time.

question.text: What is causing a delay?
According to the speaker, after how long will the presentation begin?
What will happen when the listeners should return?
choices: (C) A keynote speaker will appear on the stage.

question.text: During the peak season, it is _____ to hire additional workers for the weekend shifts.

answer.explanation:
- Need adjectives after "is" => choose C
Note:
- be necessary to V

question.text: This afternoon’s flights to Barcelona, London, and Rome have all been delayed ___ inclement weather in the destination cities.

answer.explanation: Due to = Because of

question.text: The National Health Organization reported on the  _____  cases of the disease.

answer.explanation: The blank is before a noun, so you can fill one more adjective.

question.text: At midnight, the second shift of security guards ___ on duty.

answer.explanation: (C) Present tense indicates “habit”, which is logical here; this also requires an -5 ending for the third person (shift). Choice (A) is the progressive. Choice (B) is the infinitive. Choice (D) is present tense but not third person.

question.text: It is always advisable to verify departure times, ___ flight schedules may change after a ticket is issued.

answer.explanation: Since = Because

question.text: The supervisor allowed Mr. Martin to take three additional vacation days because of his  _____  achievement.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words
=> Choose B

question.text: If the new athletic shoes do well in the smaller test markets, their nationwide launch could be  _____ .

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=>B

question.text: Mr. Vieira is  _____  with introducing several changes that have helped Stacatti Stationery increase business.

answer.explanation: Based on structure: credited with

question.text: The office is right___the street from the subway station.

answer.explanation: (B) “Across the street from” means “on the other side of the street”. Choices (A), (C), and (D) are not followed by “from”.

question.text: The final purchase price was higher than the investors ___.

answer.explanation: (A) “Was higher” is already past tense, so to establish an earlier past; use the past participle had expected. Choice (B) is the simple form. Choice (C) is the present progressive. Choice (D) is the future.

question.text: During the hotel renovation, special ___ was given to the lighting fixtures and decorations.

answer.explanation: Attention = Focus

question.text: Greenleaf Press will soon publish a ___ pocket version of Manuel Santiago's book An Insider's Guide to Travel in Argentina.

answer.explanation: Condensed = Made smaller = Shortened

question.text: The office requires that all employees park ___ in their spaces.

answer.explanation: (C) “Spaces” must be modified by an adjective. Choices (A) and (D) are adjectives, but are not logical. Choice (B) is a noun.

question.text: A private reception for gallery donors will be _____ on March 5, prior to the grand opening of the exhibit.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words
=>Choose A

question.text: Since jobs in the global division require extensive international travel, employees must be able to ___ to unfamiliar situations.

answer.explanation: Adapt to a situation = Be ready to change in a situation

question.text: ......the most challenging aspect of accepting a new position is negotiating a salary that is both fair and satisfying.

answer.explanation:
- Need to fill in a first adverb. C, D are wrong.
- Based on the meaning of the answer A.

question.text: The sales director will give a brief talk _____ the keynote speaker is introduced.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words
=> Choose A

question.text: The___speech made the audience restless.

answer.explanation: (A) The speech causes the audience to feel restless; it is active so uses the present participle. Choice (B) is the past participle. Choice (C) is present tense. Choice (D) is base form or present tense.

question.text: Patrons who arrive at the theater ___ the show has begun will not be seated until the intermission.

answer.explanation: While the first clause uses simple present tense, the second clause uses perfect present tense. This means that the second clause happens before the first clause so we use "after".

question.text: Smooth Tek’s newest software makes it much  _____ for business owners to create newsletters.

answer.explanation: Before the blank is "much", often use "much" in comparison  before the adjective to emphasize

question.text: Mr. Koster is negotiating the —of the new contract with Arban, Inc.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word 'to choose the correct answer
=> Choose A

question.text: For optimal safety on the road, avoid _____ the view of the rear window and side-view mirrors.

answer.explanation: avoid+ Ving

question.text: At Imprint Eyewear, most prescription eyeglasses can be made  ______ two business days.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=> D

question.text: The charity’s new reading program is  _____  to increase literacy rates in developing countries over the next ten years.

answer.explanation:
subject is "program" => use passive form
=> Choose C

question.text: By the time Clear Blaze Technology's word processing program goes on the market, software engineers ___ its remaining flaws.

answer.explanation: With the phrase "by the time" in present tense, the following clause will use future perfect tense.

question.text: The Garrison Theater will  _____  allow student groups to view rehearsals during the day.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words
=>Choose C

question.text: The lawyers report that the merger was successfully concluded  _____ last-minute negotiations.

answer.explanation: After the blank is a noun phrase => need a preposition that is reasonable in meaning.

question.text: We can’t work on a solution until we___the source of the problem.

answer.explanation: (D) “Identify” Is the main verb of the second clause in this sentence. Choice (A) is a noun. Choice (B) is a verb but belongs to a different word family and has a meaning that doesn’t fit the context. Choice (C) is a noun.

question.text: The Pontilet 5000 quickly calculates the shortest ___ to your destination and provides step-by-step directions.

answer.explanation: Route = Road = Way

question.text: Eun-Yi Roh ------ to assistant deputy attorney after last week's performance review.

answer.explanation: "last week" is the signal of past simple

question.text: On February 3 WXO Radio will celebrate its fiftieth anniversary. That’s half a century of stimulating (1) _____ . Over the years, we (2) _____ our listeners breaking news, thought-provoking stories, and popular music from around the world. Now we invite you to celebrate with us during an open house from 5:00 P.M. to 6:30 P.M. on February 3 at our Eighth Street studio. Take a tour and see some of the behind-the-scenes magic. Watch a demonstration of our digital audio equipment. (3) _____ . The open house is free, but registration is required. We hope you can join us for this (4) _____ occasion
On February 3 WXO Radio will celebrate its fiftieth anniversary. That’s half a century of stimulating (1) _____ .

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words

question.text: Over the years, we (2) _____ our listeners breaking news, thought-provoking stories, and popular music from around the world.

answer.explanation: The hint is "over the years" => use present perfect

question.text: Take a tour and see some of the behind-the-scenes magic. Watch a demonstration of our digital audio equipment. (3) _____.
choices: (A) We plan to merge with another local radio station next year.
(B) You can even meet some of your favorite broadcasters.
(C) This is the first event in our February schedule.
(D) This station continues to be a vital part of your community.

answer.text: (B) You can even meet some of your favorite broadcasters.
answer.explanation: Based on the previous sentence.

question.text: We hope you can join us for this (4) _____ occasion

answer.explanation: We need an adjective to modify the noun "occasion"

question.text:
Garden Shade Tree Landscaping
Garden Shade creates tree landscapes and hedges to suit every garden, no matter the size. Our designs have ---1---small urban gardens as well as large-scale projects commissioned by architects and property developers. ---2---- . However, no single nursery can offer trees of all species and sizes. That is why Garden Shade has developed close relationships with many specialist growers –- 3--- to provide us with the trees we need . Such resources give us the variety necessary to complete any ---4---- . In other words, whatever your landscape design dream, we can make it happen.

answer.explanation: Based on meaning to choose the correct answer

choices: (A) We are here to answer your landscaping questions.
(B) For most projects, we use trees from our own nurseries.
(C) Some trees have specific growing requirements.
(D) Under normal conditions, nursery stock is guaranteed for one year.

answer.text: (B) For most projects, we use trees from our own nurseries.
answer.explanation: Select (B) because the previous sentence has “project”.
Choose (D) since it is a propositional reduction form relationship. The full sentence is “ ... many specialists growers (who are) ready to provide us ... ”
Based on meaning to choose the correct answer

question.text:
Vander Properties

Vander Properties has been serving Houston for over 29 years. It is through our commitment to providing the highest degree of expertise market knowledge and (1) _____ are service that we recognized as an industry leader. We specialize in (2) _____ and corporate real estate here in the Denver area. (3) _____ you are looking to buy a new home or start a new business, we are the people you should be talking with. With our office centrally located downtown, we have our eyes on the whole city. Browse our site for listing, or give us a call today (4) _____.
www.vanderproperties.com
Phone: (313) 782-9919
Address: 834 Walton St.
It is through our commitment to providing the highest degree of expertise market knowledge and (1) _____ are service that we recognized as an industry leader.

answer.explanation: We need a word that can modify the noun "service". "Personalizing" and "personalized" can both be adjectives to modify the noun, but in terms of meaning, "personalized service" is more reasonable than "personalizing service"

question.text: We specialize in (2) _____ and corporate real estate here in the Denver area.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words.

question.text: (3) _____ you are looking to buy a new home or start a new business, we are the people you should be talking with.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of conjunctions.

question.text: Browse our site for listing, or give US a call today (4) _____.
choices: (A) Take a drive out of town and come see us today.
(C) Of course, drop-ins are always welcome.
(D) Our kitchen is open from eight to five daily.

answer.text: (C) Of course, drop-ins are always welcome.
answer.explanation: Based on the previous sentence: "Browse our site for listing, or give us a call today (4) _____."

question.text:
To:Janet Doe
From:Greenscape
Date:June 28
Subject:Inquiry

Ms. Doe,
We thank you for your inquiry. Greenscape has been the leading landscaper for businesses in the greater downtown area for over 10 years. (1) _____ we specialize in gardens and Japanese- style landscape art, we also maintain lawns and fields. But to answer your question, yes, we even clear away thick shrubbery and trees. We can send a person to (2) _____ the amount of time it will take and the approximate costs. Furthermore, if you (3) _____ to replace the dense shrubs with a lawn or garden, you can work with one of our designers to come up with a landscape you can be happy with.
(4) _____ We are more than happy to serve you.
(1) _____ we specialize in gardens and Japanese- style landscape art, we also maintain lawns and fields.

answer.explanation: Both "Therefore" and "However" are grammatically incorrect. Based on the meaning of sentence, choose "although"

question.text: We can send a person to (2) _____ the amount of time it will take and the approximate costs.

answer.explanation: "the approximate costs" => "estimate" is correct

question.text: Furthermore, if you (3) _____ to replace the dense shrubs with a lawn or garden, you can work with one of our designers to come up with a landscape you can be happy with.

answer.explanation: Conditional sentence type I: If + S + V(present tense", S + will/can/may/should/... + V-infinitive

question.text: (4) _____ We are more than happy to serve you.
choices: (A) We welcome any business opportunity with you.
(B) Please don’t hesitate to email any questions you have.
(C) Please call US at 555-1245 if you are interested in a consultation.
(D) Visit our website for more information.

answer.text: (C) Please call US at 555-1245 if you are interested in a consultation.
answer.explanation: Based on the following sentence.

question.text:
To: Aaron Sandler asandler@milleradvertising.com
From: Sam Miller
Subject: Tuesday’s Meeting
Date: November 12

Dear Mr. Sandler,

This month’s business review meeting is scheduled for Thursday, November 15. As you know, this meeting is a great opportunity for US to assess our operating plan and to make any adjustments that might help US keep up with constant changes in the marketplace. As an advertising agency, it’s crucial we stay informed about the newest market trends. Therefore, I was excited when I heard that Tsuyoshi Ito, manager of our Japanese branch, would be visiting this Friday. In order to take advantage of his expertise and knowledge, I would like to change the meeting date so that Mr. Ito can attend.

This will be Mr. Ito’s first time in the country, so I would like you to pick him up from the airport. A company car will be provided to you for this purpose. I will e-mail again once I have more details concerning Mr. Ito’s arrival time.

Sincerely,

Sam Miller
President
Miller Advertising
What is the purpose of the e-mail?
choices: (B) To request a monthly operating report
(D) To propose a new marketing strategy

answer.explanation: The information is in: "This month’s business review meeting is scheduled for Thursday, November 15."

question.text: What does the e-mail indicate about Mr. Ito?
choices: (D) He is a client of Mr. Miller’s.

answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "As an advertising agency, it’s crucial we stay informed about the newest market trends. Therefore, I was excited when I heard that Tsuyoshi Ito, manager of our Japanese branch, would be visiting this Friday. "

question.text: @PS@/kstoeic/images/3618288_1562639933477.png@PE@

question.text: At 10:14, what does Judy mean when she writes “we’ll have to split the bill”?

question.text:
Wellington
04 499 9999


Joan Huygens
287 McMillan Ave.
Wellington 6011

Dear Ms. Huygens,

I am writing to express our gratilude to you for being a faithful customer of Genex Hair Design (GHD) for the last ten years. We greatly appreciate the fact that over the years you have helped our business grow by introducing us to your relatives and friends.

As a token of our appreciation, please accept the enclosed $20 gift certificate. It is valid for two months from the day of issue and redeemable at any of our salons. Use it toward your next hair treatment or the purchase of your favorite hair products.

We appreciate your business and we are looking forward to serving you for many more years to come.

Marina Prasad

question.text:
For Sale by Owner

Palmer standard Cabin Yacht


Asking price: $45,000 or best offer

Basic Specifications:
This boat was built four years ago. It is 12 feet wide by 36 feet long. The hull is made of fiberglass, making it light yet strong. The boat includes 2 double bedrooms as well as a sleeper sofa, kitchen, and bathroom.

Features:
This boat is very stable and offers a spacious deck. It is perfect for large \ families and social gatherings. It includes an eight-speaker sound system 1 with USB connectivity. It also has a lockable storage compartment where personal belongings can be kept.

Additional Information:
I have owned and operated this boat for three and a half years. The boat comes with a five-year warranty that still has one and a half years

If you would like to see or test-ride the boat, contact Gary Thompson at 654-555-8715.

question.text:
Milltown Community Theater
Board Meeting Minutes
Sunday, November 16
Milltown Public Library


OPENING: President Eliot Rogers conducted the meeting. He introduced the new board member, Anita Russell Ms. Russell has volunteered at the theater since its beginning. She most recently worked to successfully secure financial support for next seasons productions.

MINUTES: Minutes from the September 28 meeting were approved with, minor corrections.

FINANCIAL REPORT: Die financial statements from October were reviewed by Patty Schmidt, Treasurer. She explained that recent reductions noted in the operating fund were due to a rise in the price of heating oil Schmidt noted that a grant has been received from the Acme Savings Bank. These funds will be used, to initiate a summer program for children.

DEVELOPMENT COMMITTEE: Members of the committee led discussions of recent attempts to obtain new grants, other fund-raising possibilities, and an initiative to attract publicity for the theater through local businesses.

NEXT BOARD MEETING: The next meeting of the board, will be on. Sunday January 25, at 2:00 PM. in the Milltown Public Library.

Meeting adjourned, at 3:45 RM,
Respectfully submitted,
Nancy Fordham.
Who was in charge of conducting the meeting?

answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: "President Eliot Rogers conducted the meeting."

question.text: What has recently increased?
choices: (A)The cost of gifts for new board members
(C)Expenses for a summer program for children

answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: "She explained that recent reductions noted in the operating fund were due to a rise in the price of heating oil Schmidt noted that a grant has been received from the Acme Savings Bank."

question.text: What was NOT discussed in the meeting?
choices: (D) The report of the September meeting

answer.explanation:
Members of the committee led discussions of recent attempts to obtain new grants, other fund-raising possibilities, and an initiative to attract publicity for the theater through local businesses. => Eliminate A&B
Minutes from the September 28 meeting were approved with, minor corrections. => Eliminate D

question.text:
To: Stacey Johnson
From: Josh Fleck
Date: October 22
Subject: Strategic Planning

Dear Ms. Johnson,

District Management at Topline Electronics would like to inform you about a new development that will be affecting your store. Another competing consumer electronics store will be opening in the Crayville area on November 12.

In order to ensure that Topline Electronics does not lose business to this new store, District Management is advising you to run a special sale on our new line of curved UHD televisions. These televisions provide state-of-the-art features at moderate prices. By showing your customers that Topline Electronics offers the best deals in the area, you will be able to maintain customer loyalty. We will be shipping the new televisions to your store within the next week. We suggest you prepare a prominent display space in your store to feature them. You should also update your website to advertise the sale.

Smooth communication between you and US is vital to effective operational practices. If you have any questions concerning the new televisions or the marketing campaign in general, please don’t hesitate to contact District Management.

Sincerely,

Josh Fleck District Manager,
Topline Electronics
Who most likely is Ms. Johnson?

answer.explanation: District Management at Topline Electronics would like to inform you about a new development that will be affecting your store. It can be inferred from the passage that Ms. Johnson owns a store.

question.text: What is indicated about Topline Electronics?
choices: (A) It recently opened a new store location.
(B) It will be relocated to the Crayville area.
(C) It is concerned about market competition.
(D) It was nominated for an annual award.

answer.text: (C) It is concerned about market competition.
answer.explanation: The information is in: "In order to ensure that Topline Electronics does not lose business to this new store, District Management is advising you to run a special sale on our new line of curved UHD televisions."

question.text: What is Ms. Johnson NOT instructed to do?
choices: (A) Add new information to a website

answer.explanation:
(A) - You should also update your website to advertise the sale.
(C) - If you have any questions concerning the new televisions or the marketing campaign in general, please don’t hesitate to contact District Management.
(D) - We suggest you prepare a prominent display space in your store to feature them.

question.text:
Bill Flake (9:41)
Hello, I'd like to get an update on the progress of the drapes that the Manillo Family ordered.
Lucy Mitt (9:41)
We're still waiting for the lace silks from Hand-Made Lace but we received most of the other fabrics yesterday. Our seamstresses will get to work on those today.
Bill Flake (9:42)
Then do you think the project will be completed by this Friday as the Manillo's wanted?
Lucy Mitt (9:43)
I'm not sure. It'll depend on when the lace arrives. Our group can start sewing some of the pieces together, but we need the lace to complete the intricate designs.
Bill Flake (9:44)
Can you contact Hand-Made Lace and find out when the shipment arrives?
Lucy Mitt (9:45)
Actually, Richard is taking care of that. Any word from them, Richard?
Richard Choi (9:45)
Yes, I just got off the phone with them. There was a bit of a delay because the lace artisans used the wrong silks. They had to re-work the lace. We'll receive them this afternoon. They sent a rush delivery to US.
Bill Flake (9:46)
Excellent. Then can the drapes be finished at the end of this week?
Lucy Mitt (9:47)
No problem. We'll work around the clock to get them finished on time.
Bill Flake (9:48)
I'm glad to hear that. They are long-time customers and they needed the drapes for their new condo this weekend.
What kind of business do the participants in the online chat probably work at?

answer.explanation: “Hello, I'd like to get an update on the progress of the drapes that the Manillo Family ordered.”

question.text: When will the shipment of lace arrive?
choices: (D) At the end of the week

answer.explanation: “Yes, I just got off the phone with them. There was a bit of a delay because the lace artisans used the wrong silks. They had to re-work the lace. We'll receive them this afternoon. They sent a rush delivery to us. ”

question.text: At 9:47, what does Lucy Mitt mean when she says, “We’ll work around the clock”?
choices: (A) Her team will watch the time carefully.
(B) Her team will work as quickly as possible.
(C) Her team will take as much time as they need.
(D) Her team will work all day and night if they have to.

answer.text: (D) Her team will work all day and night if they have to.
answer.explanation: “No problem, we'll work around the clock to get them finished on time.”

question.text: What will Bill Flake probably do next?

answer.explanation: Because Lucy Mitt makes sure to work day and night to get it done as quickly as possible, Mr. Bill Flake might call the client.

question.text:
Ann Novak [1:31 P.M.]
Hello, everyone. Last week when we met, I asked you to come up with strategies to bring attention to the community garden program. Does anyone have progress to reports?
Jay Goodwin [1:32 P.M.]
I reached out to Stuart Chan of City Wide Now, the local newspaper. You probably know his "City Living" column.
Mike Louden [1:33 P.M.]
The one that runs on Mondays? I never miss it!
Jay Goodwin [1:34 P.M.]
He has a large online following, too. He'd like to interview me for an upcoming issue. So that's happening next week.
Ann Novak [1:34 P.M.]
Wonderful. Will you talk about the community garden in general?
Jay Goodwin [1:35 P.M.]
I explained to Stuart that we are surveying members of the garden about issues regarding access to water. So he wants to focus on that.
Mike Louden [1:36 P.M.]
Lori and I are writing up the survey results. Ann. I'm getting ready to send you a draft. As soon as you have approved it, I can post it on our Web site.
Ann Novak [1:37 P.M.]
OK. I'll look it over this afternoon.
What is indicated about Ms. Novak?
choices: (B) She has just returned from a trip.
(C) She does not like Mr. Goodwin's idea.
(D) She gave her colleagues an assignment.

answer.text: (D) She gave her colleagues an assignment.
answer.explanation:
From the very first message in the chat, we can see “I asked you to come up with strategies to bring attention to the community garden program. ” (I have asked you to come up with a strategy to draw attention to the community garden program).
As such, Ms. Novak has assigned her work to her colleagues.

question.text: Who is Mr. Chan?

answer.explanation: Information is located on Jay Goodwin's message at 1:32 'I reached out to Stuart Chan of City Wide Now, the local newspaper I reached out to Stuart Chan of City Wide Now , the local newspaper ”(I have accessed to Stuart Chan of the City Wide Now, local newspaper). Mr. Chan works for the local newspaper, so out of the answers he is probably the most likely reporter.

question.text: At 1:33 P.M., what does Mr. Louden most likely mean when he writes, "I never miss it"?
choices: (A) He enjoys participating in community activities.
(C) He subscribes to City Wide Now.

answer.explanation: In a 1:32 text message, Jay Goodwin mentions "City Living" column "and Mike Louden replied that “I never miss it” (I never miss it). As such, Louden very often reads the column.

question.text: What does Mr. Louden indicate he will do?

answer.explanation:
Mike Louden told Ann Novak at the end of the chat: “As soon as you have approved it, I can post it on our Web site” (As soon as you approve it, I can post it on their website)
That means Mr. Louden will be posting material online.

question.text: Question 172-175 refer to the following e-mail.
What most likely is Mr. Ruzinski?

answer.explanation: According to the content of the email, Ruzinski is asked to replace a member of a team that is handling the finance of the Gartera store. Therefore, Ruzinski has to do in this field as well. Of all the answers given, answer B is the most suitable.

question.text: What has Ms. Alves requested?

answer.explanation: Information contained in the sentence “I have notified your team leader, Hyun Shik, who agreed to let me borrow you for a few days” (I informed your team leader, Hyun Shil, who had agreed to let me borrow you for a few days.) With that, Ms. Alves asked Ruzinski's team leader to reassign his staff, and take Ruzinski to her team for a few days.

question.text: Why does Ms. Alves offer to meet with Mr. Ruzinski?
choices: (C)To plan the hiring of new employees

answer.explanation: Information on “I would be happy to meet with you to show you how to use the software to meet those tasks”

question.text: In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3] and [4] does the following sentence best belong?

answer.explanation: The sentence before the required position should appear a noun indicating the person equivalent to "he" in a given sentence. So, in the empty positions, we can see that only [3] can satisfy.

question.text:
Brand-X Coming to Town

March 9 - Popular Danish skincare company Brand-X is finally launching their best-selling line in America. The 88-year-old company has been Denmark's leading skincare brand and the top selling cream, Xtreme 7, has been Europe's most popular facial cream for over 10 years. Though Americans may not have had access to these creams before, the brand is already generating much excitement. Dermatologist Dr. Francis Keenan explains, "Tests have shown that Xtreme 7 dramatically reduces the fine lines around the eye area and laugh lines after only 30 days of use, but the price of the cream is only a fraction of what department store brands sell for. I'll definitely recommend this cream to my clients."
"People have been asking about Xtreme 7 but the products haven't even arrived yet!" added Susan Chan, an employee at a beauty counter. "People are already calling in to pre-order."
A spokesperson for the company explained that Brand-X is making moves to expand into the North American and Asian markets. For now, only the best-selling line will be available sometime next month, outside of Europe, but within a year, more products will be available

==========================

Brand-X Positions at American Headquarters in Westminster, California

Don’t miss your chance to work in an exciting career in skincare and beauty with Brand-X. 80 administrative and customer service positions will be available regardless of experience. Applicants need to have good communication skills, bilingual ability in both English and Spanish is preferred but not necessary, and knowledge in computer use is a must. Applicants with experience in cosmetics, dermatology, or marketing will get a chance to work in several management positions for Brand-X. Please visit our website at www.brandx.com/jobs for more information. You can fill out the application forms and send them in before March 20th. Interviews will take place at Hillway Building on 143 Garden Road. Be sure to bring your resumes and reference letters.

===========================

To: Professor David Mills
From: Jacqueline O’Hare
Date: March 28
Subject: Job

Dear Professor Mills,
Thank you so much for the reference letter you supplied me with. I was recently hired by Brand-X and I begin my orientations next week Wednesday at 10:00 A.M. However, we have our statistics test at that time. Is there any way that I can take a make-up test at a different time or hand in another assignment as a replacement for the test? I would hate to miss the orientations which are mandatory and I don't want to disappoint my new employers. The job should not have any other impact on my school work otherwise. I kindly appreciate your consideration in this.
Sincerely,
Jacqueline O’Hare
What is suggested about Brand-X?
choices: (A) Products are currently only available in Europe.
(B) It is Europe’s most popular brand.
(C) It is a luxury skincare company.
(D) The company was first launched 10 years ago.

answer.text: (A) Products are currently only available in Europe.
answer.explanation:
From the last sentence of the article “For now, only the best-selling line will be available sometime next month, outside of Europe, but within a year, more products will be available. ”
Sold outside of Europe, so it can be inferred that the products are currently only available in Europe.

question.text: What is indicated in the advertisement?
choices: (A) All positions don’t require previous work experience.
(C) Experience in certain fields can lead to management positions.
(D) The available positions are only temporary.

answer.text: (C) Experience in certain fields can lead to management positions.
answer.explanation: The information contained in the phrase “Applicants with experience in cosmetics, dermatology, or marketing will get a chance to work in several management positions for Brand-X”

question.text: Accordingto the article, what does Brand-X plan to do?

answer.explanation: The information is in the first sentence of the last paragraph of the article “A spokesperson for the company explained that Brand-X is making moves to expand into the North American and Asian market”

question.text: What does Dr. Keenan suggest about xtreme 7?
choices: (A) It is the most effective cream on the market.
(B) It is worth the high price tag.
(C) It is both effective and cheap.
(D) It is the only cream that doctors would recommend.

answer.text: (C) It is both effective and cheap.
answer.explanation:
You can infer from the sentence “Dermatologist Dr. Francis Keenan explains, “Tests have shown that Xtreme 7 reduces the fine lines around the eye area and laugh lines after only 30 days of use, but the price of the cream is only a fraction of what department store brands sell for”

So this product is efficient and its price is not as expensive as the other brands.

question.text: For what position was Jacqueline most likely hired?

answer.explanation: From email, it can be inferred that Ms. Jacqueline is still born. tablets. So she didn't have any experience in marketing or dermatology yet so she couldn't work as a manager. In addition, the vacancies are only administrative and customer service, so the position that Ms. Jacqueline is recruited will be customer service.

question.text:
To: Imogen Chambers - ichambers
From: Reginald Lee - rlee@cooperandcolson1aw.org
Re: Office supplies order
Date: March 20
Dear Ms. Chambers,
We have a standing order filled by Champion Office Supply, with automatic delivery to us on the first day of each month. I am writing because we would like to modify our usual order for the upcoming month as outlined on the attached form. Please note that we would like the ink toner that we have ordered in the past to be replaced by a different brand as indicated. Furthermore, we would like to add item WB918 to the order only t is month, as we have recently hired new attorneys and we are preparing additional office spaces for them. Please use our credit card account that you have on file.
We continue to be pleased with the quality of your merchandise, especially stationery products with our firm’s logo.
Thank you.
Reginald Lee, Office Manager
Cooper and Colson Law

===========================
Order for: Cooper and Colson Law
Contact: Reginald Lee
Delivery date: April 1  
Item Description Item Number Quantity Price Per Unit Itemized Total
Printed letterhead LH228 10 Reams 54.00 540.00
Whiteboard pens WP263 10 Packages of 4 4.99 49.90
Cytronics ink toner cartridge CP576 8 42.00 336.00
Witeglow Magnetic
Whiteboard(50”x35”)		 WB918 4 79.99 319.96
CHAMPION OFFICE SUPPLY
TAX     :    74.75
TOTAl: $1320.61 
============================
To: Reginald Lee - rlee@cooperandcolsonlaw.org
From: Imogen Chambers - ichambers@championos.com
Re: Office supplies order
Date: March 21
Dear Mr. Lee,
We would be happy to accommodate your requests as outlined on your order form. Unfortunately, however, we are currently out of the Witeglow brand whiteboards. I can recommend another brand of magnetic whiteboard that has been well liked by other customers, called Stellar Whiteboards. They are considered the best on the market. They are typically $85 each, but I am willing to provide four at the same cost of the Witeglow brand, if you would like to give them a try. Just let me know. Thank you.
Kind regards,
Imogen Chambers
What is the purpose of the first e-mail?
choices: (C)To make a complaint about a product

answer.explanation: Because the item to be placed is no longer available and there is a saying “I can recommend another brand of magnetic whiteboard ” => answer A

question.text: In the first e-mail, what is indicated about Cooper and Colson Law?
choices: (A)It has just installed a new photocopier.
(C)It is in the process of relocating
(D)It has  just  hired  a new office manager.

answer.explanation: “We are preparing additional office spaces” => equivalent to preparing additional office spaces

question.text: What product is Mr. Lee particularly pleased with?

answer.explanation: "Firm's logo" is equivalent to the logo (by means letterhead) of companies => choose the answer A

question.text: What item number identifies a replacement for a regularly ordered product?

answer.explanation: “Ink toner that we have order in the past to be replaced by ....”. In the application, sometimes the new ink toner is CP576

question.text: How much will the law firm pay for each Stellar brand whiteboard?

answer.explanation:
Opposite code WB918 => price is

79.99

question.text:
From: Carrie Cook - carriecook@freshfarmsgrocery.com
To: Charles Bell - charlesbell434@globalnet.com
Subject: Membership Card
Date: May 4

Dear Mr. Bell,
Your Silver star Membership Card at Fresh Farms Grocery will expire on the 28th of this month. Your membership card entitles you to special sale prices as well as special points on most Fresh Farms Grocery purchases. Once you accumulate enough points, they can be redeemed for a discount on your next purchase. Without a valid Silver star Membership Card, you will lose the ability to accumulate these frequent shopper points.

Please do not attempt to renew your membership over the phone. In order to do that, please stop by the customer service desk at one of our store locations. If you have any other questions, please call us at 204-555-2648.

Carrie Cook
Customer Service Representative
Fresh Farms Grocery

===========================

Fresh Farms Grocery

Membership Card Form

First Name: Charles
Last Name: Bell
Membership Number: IH2H5F0A

□ Create my membership card □X Renew my membership card
□ Cancel my membership card

Membership card categories and fees:
Gold Star:Premium membership, $90 a year
Silver Star:Business membership, $70 a year
Bronze star:Household membership, $50 a year
Shooting star: Short-term membership, $10 a month

Please note:
Premium membership is reserved for those who hold shares in the Fresh Farms Grocery company.
Food vendors and restaurant owners are eligible to apply for the Silver Star Membership Card.
What is the purpose of the e-mail?
choices: (B) To notify Mr. Bell of an outstanding fee
(C) To remind Mr. Bell to renew a membership
(D) To offer a free upgrade to Mr. Bell

answer.text: (C) To remind Mr. Bell to renew a membership
answer.explanation:
- First sentence:

"Your Silver Star Membership Card at Fresh Farms Grocery will expire on the 28th of this month."

question.text: What does the membership card allow Mr. Bell to do?

answer.explanation:
- The last 3 sentences of paragraph 1:

"Your membership card entitles you to special sale prices as well as special points on most Fresh Farms Grocery purchases. Once you accumulate enough points, they can be redeemed for a discount on your next purchase. Without a valid Silver Star Membership, you will lose the ability to accumulate these frequent shopper points."

question.text: What is Mr. Bell asked to do?

answer.explanation: <font>"Please do not attempt to renew your membership over the phone. </font><font>In order to do that, please stop by the customer service desk at one of our store locations."</font>

question.text: How much does Mr.. Bell currently pay a year?

answer.explanation:
From questions 181 & 182 => Mr. Bell's card is a silver star card (Silver Star)

=> check down the classification line and the fee applicable to silver star card:

Silver Star: Business membership, $ 70 a year => choose answer B

question.text: What is indicated about Mr. Bell?
choices: (C) He is a shareholder of Fresh Farms Grocery.
(D) He applied for his membership this year.

answer.explanation:
- The last sentence in the form:

Food vendors and restaurant owners are eligible to apply for the Silver Star Membership Card.

question.text:
September 21—What is the secret to delicious home-cooked meals? Kimberly Lee, host of the My Home Cooking television show and owner of her own restaurant chain, seems to know all the secrets. Her show has been on the air for over two years, and now she has a devoted group of followers around the country. When she sat down for an interview with US, she said that fresh vegetables and local produce are the key to cooking healthy and tasty food.
Ms. Lee is scheduled to publish her very first cookbook near the end of the month. The book is entitled Kimberly Lee’s My Home Cooking, and it provides easy-to- follow recipes that can be made in less than 30 minutes. Over 40,000 copies have already been pre-ordered so far.
Ms. Lee says that the final page of the book will include a detachable fan club membership form. Those who fill the form out and send it in to the provided address will receive a monthly newsletter and exclusive recipes available only to those in the fan club. Fan club members will also receive a password that allows access to a fan club website.

===========================

To: Kimberly Lee-kimberlylee@kimberlylee.com
From: Suzie Sanders - suziesanders@kimberlylee.com
Date: October 12
Subject: Update

Dear Ms. Lee,
Great news! I’m happy to report that not only has your book been selling well, but the number of new members joining the fan club has been increasing drastically since it was published. I’m certain that the article in the newspaper helped generate considerable publicity for your book.
Also, we have received a lot of feedback from new members expressing a desire for more recipes for cakes, cookies, and candies to be featured in next month’s newsletter. I think it would be a good idea to meet their needs this time.
Sincerely,

Suzie Sanders Publicity
Coordinator
What is the first thing to do in order to become a fan club member?

answer.explanation: At the end of the article she Lee says the last page of the book has a membership registration form. So to be able to get the registration form, the first thing to do is to buy that book.

question.text: What is the main purpose of the article?
choices: (B) To provide advice for professional chefs

answer.explanation: It is easy to see that the main content of the article is about Ms. Lee and her upcoming book. So the correct answer is A.

question.text: What is suggested about next month’s newsletter?
choices: (A) It will be mailed behind schedule.
(B) It will feature a column about healthy eating habits.
(C) It will contain an article on desserts.
(D) It will include a copy of Ms. Lee’s book.

answer.text: (C) It will contain an article on desserts.
answer.explanation:
Derived from the last two sentences of the letter: “Also, we have received a lot of feedback from new members expressing a desire for more recipes for cakes, cookies, and candies to be featured in next month's newsletter. I think it would be a good idea to meet their needs this time. ”
So if they meet the members' request, next month's letter will have recipes for desserts like cakes and candies.

question.text: In the e-mail, what does Suzie Sanders say about the article?
choices: (A) It was written by a famous journalist.
(B) It was featured on a popular cooking website.
(C) It helped increase fan club membership.
(D) It contained excerpts from Ms. Lee’s book.

answer.text: (C) It helped increase fan club membership.
answer.explanation: The information at the beginning of the email: “the number of new members joining the fan club has been increasing drastically since it was published. I'm certain that the article in the newspaper helped generate considerable publicity for your book. ”

question.text: Accordingto Ms. Lee, what is the secret to successful cooking?

answer.explanation: Information in the following sentence in the article “she said that fresh vegetables and local produce are the key to cooking healthy and tasty food”

question.text:
To: Aaron Donald
From: James Holt
Date: Jan. 12
Subject:First Quarter Performance Review

Dear Aaron,

I just wanted to give you a heads-up that the performance evaluations are going to be going forward as discussed. I know this was an area of stress for you in the fourth quarter of last year, so I wanted to give you plenty of advanced warning. You will need to bring your numbers up significantly if you want to pass the review. As you know, we have been struggling to make our sales goals over the past several years, and I am afraid Mr. Jones is determined to trim the staff if things don't change. I have far exceeded my target numbers, so I have included an attachment with some possible leads for sales. Give them a shot.

Good luck,
James

===========================

To: James Holt
From: Aaron Donald
Date: Jan. 12
Subject: First Quarter Performance Review

James,

Thank you so much for the leads. I will get on them right away. I don't know why my sales are slumping so much lately in the technologies division. It seems like every sales technique 1 learned in school isn't working anymore. I am thinking about changing industries if I don't pass our review when it comes out in March. My sister is opening a beauty parlor and she was asking me to become a barber. Imagine that! Anyway, thank you again for the notice about the possible layoffs coming up. I will try to get my numbers up to standards, but I think that Mr. Jones may have already decided to let me go.

All the best,
Aaron

===========================
 
Possible Sales Leads for January
Name Division Account Potential Rating
Sally Jones Technologies $35,000-$50,000 Silver
Bod Knuddle Technologies $100,000 and up Gold
Marquise Lee Technologies $12,000-$20,000 Bronze/Silver
What is most likely true about James and Aaron?
What is the job that Mr. Jones most likely has?
According to the information provided, what is true about James?
choices: (A) He has done very well at work.
(C) He wants to work with Aaron.

answer.text: (A) He has done very well at work.

question.text: What is indicated about Aaron?
choices: (A) He is not very good at his job these days.
(C) There are problems in the main office.
(D)  He will keep his job after the evaluations come in.

answer.text: (A) He is not very good at his job these days.

question.text: What is the problem with the sales leads James gave to Aaron?
choices: (B) They are worth too much money.
(D) They are in a field Aaron is struggling in.

answer.text: (D) They are in a field Aaron is struggling in.
